description: Write product of first n primes as x*y with x<y and x maximal; sequence gives value of x.
comments: Or, lower central divisor of n-th primorial.Subsequence of A005117 (squarefree numbers). - _Michel Marcus_, Feb 22 2016
maple: F:= proc(n) local P,N,M;     P:= {seq(ithprime(i),i=1..n)};     N:= floor(sqrt(convert(P,`*`)));     M:= map(convert, combinat:-powerset(P),`*`);     max(select(`<=`,M,N))end proc:map(F, [$1..20]); # _Robert Israel_, Feb 22 2016
prog: a(n) = my(m=prod(i=1, n, prime(i))); divisors(m)[numdiv(m)\2]; \\ _Michel Marcus_, Feb 22 2016
author: _Labos Elemer_, Apr 27 2001
extensions: More terms from _Ed Pegg Jr_, May 28 2001
Terms 16 through 23 computed by _Jud McCranie_, Apr 15 2000
a(24) and a(25) from _Robert Israel_, Feb 22 2016
